radiographic_examinations.findings: Diverticulosis is seen throughout the distal colon with thickening of the colon wall in the left lower quadrant, surrounding fat stranding, and a few locules of gas noted extra luminally. The visualized portion of the lungs, heart, vessels, liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, small intestine, bladder, prostate, and rectum are normal. No free fluid or air is seen.
